intro: Pentapanax scopulorum, commonly known as the rock pentapanax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
